snippet: Bombers struck a funeral in western Pakistan and a graveyard across the border in Afghanistan, leaving at least 44 people dead on one of the holiest days on the Muslim calendar.
abstract: Bombers strike funeral in western Pakistan and graveyard across border in Afghanistan, leaving at least 44 people dead on one of holiest days on Muslim calendar.

byline.original: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Salman Masood reported from Islamabad, and Declan Walsh from London. Matthew Rosenberg contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan, Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Bombers struck a funeral in western Pakistan and a graveyard across the border in Afghanistan, leaving at least 44 people dead on one of the holiest days on the Muslim calendar.

headline.main: Bomb Attacks Kill Dozens of Mourners in Pakistan and Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Bomb Attacks Kill Dozens of Mourners in Pakistan and Afghanistan
